headline: Stocks to Watch Wednesday Recap: Netflix, Paramount, Micron, Lennar
summary: ↘️️ Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD): The conglomerate recommended shareholders reject Paramount (PSKY)’s hostile bid, saying the Netflix (NFLX) deal is better. Warner shares slipped 2.4% Wednesday, while Paramount dropped 5.

headline: Warner Bros. chose Netflix over Paramount — again. Now what?
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery has officially rejected Paramount’s hostile takeover bid, advising its shareholders to do the same. But the battle is far from over. Let’s break down what just happened and what to expect next.

content.title: Warner Bros. chose Netflix over Paramount — again. Now what?
content.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery has officially rejected Paramount’s hostile takeover bid, advising its shareholders to do the same. But the battle is far from over. Let’s break down what just happened and what to expect next.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery advises shareholders to reject Paramount’s offer. But the battle isn’t over
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery is officially rejecting Paramount’s buyout offer, calling it “illusory” and arguing that the existing plan to sell most of the media company to Netflix is a better deal for shareholders.

content.title: Warner Bros. Discovery advises shareholders to reject Paramount’s offer. But the battle isn’t over
content.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery is officially rejecting Paramount’s buyout offer, calling it “illusory” and arguing that the existing plan to sell most of the media company to Netflix is a better deal for shareholders.

headline: Warner Bros. Urges Shareholders to Reject Paramount Bid. Netflix Stock Is Rising.
summary: Warner’s board said that Paramount had “consistently misled” shareholders by claiming that its offer had been fully backstopped by the Ellison family.

content.title: Warner Bros. Urges Shareholders to Reject Paramount Bid. Netflix Stock Is Rising.
content.summary: Warner’s board said that Paramount had “consistently misled” shareholders by claiming that its offer had been fully backstopped by the Ellison family.

headline: Oracle denies report, says data center funding is on track
summary: Yahoo Finance's John Hyland tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including Oracle (ORCL) announcing that the funding for its Michigan data center is still on track, Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) is pushing shareholders to reject Paramount Skydance's (PSKY) takeover bid in favor of Netflix's (NFLX) offer, and BlackRock (BLK) stating that it will match "Trump account" contributions for its employees. These are a type of tax-advantaged savings and investment accounts for children. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

These are a type of tax-advantaged savings and investment accounts for children.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Warner Bros accuses Paramount of misleading investors as it rejects $108bn bid
summary: Warner Bros Discovery has accused Paramount of misleading investors as it urged them to reject the company’s hostile $108bn (£81bn) takeover bid.

content.title: Warner Bros accuses Paramount of misleading investors as it rejects $108bn bid
content.summary: Warner Bros Discovery has accused Paramount of misleading investors as it urged them to reject the company’s hostile $108bn (£81bn) takeover bid.

headline: Warner Rejected Paramount’s Tender Offer. What to Know.
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery  on Wednesday recommended shareholders reject Paramount’s unsolicited bid for the company, questioning the funding structure for the deal.  In response to Warner’s rejection, Paramount said its offer is still good.  Chief Executive  David Ellison  said in a statement, “Our proposal clearly offers shareholders superior value and certainty, a clear path to close, and does not leave them with a heavily indebted sub-scale linear business.”

content.title: Warner Rejected Paramount’s Tender Offer. What to Know.
content.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery  on Wednesday recommended shareholders reject Paramount’s unsolicited bid for the company, questioning the funding structure for the deal.  In response to Warner’s rejection, Paramount said its offer is still good.  Chief Executive  David Ellison  said in a statement, “Our proposal clearly offers shareholders superior value and certainty, a clear path to close, and does not leave them with a heavily indebted sub-scale linear business.”

headline: Warner Bros. urges shareholders to accept Netflix bid over Paramount's
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) board is urging shareholders to reject Paramount Skydance's (PSKY) takeover bid in favor of Netflix's (NFLX) offer, according to a letter to shareholders. Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma and PNC Asset Management Group CIO Amanda Agati comment on the developments in the WBD-Paramount saga. Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi

content.title: Warner Bros. urges shareholders to accept Netflix bid over Paramount's
content.description:
Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) board is urging shareholders to reject Paramount Skydance's (PSKY) takeover bid in favor of Netflix's (NFLX) offer, according to a letter to shareholders.

Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma and PNC Asset Management Group CIO Amanda Agati comment on the developments in the WBD-Paramount saga.

Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi
content.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) board is urging shareholders to reject Paramount Skydance's (PSKY) takeover bid in favor of Netflix's (NFLX) offer, according to a letter to shareholders. headline: PARAMOUNT AFFIRMS COMMITMENT TO SUPERIOR $30 PER SHARE ALL-CASH OFFER FOR WARNER BROS. DISCOVERY
summary: Paramount, a Skydance Corporation (NASDAQ: PSKY) ("Paramount"), today affirmed its commitment to acquiring Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD) ("WBD") in response to the WBD Board's recommendation against Paramount's $30.00 per share all-cash tender offer.

content.title: PARAMOUNT AFFIRMS COMMITMENT TO SUPERIOR $30 PER SHARE ALL-CASH OFFER FOR WARNER BROS. DISCOVERY
content.summary: Paramount, a Skydance Corporation (NASDAQ: PSKY) ("Paramount"), today affirmed its commitment to acquiring Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD) ("WBD") in response to the WBD Board's recommendation against Paramount's $30.00 per share all-cash tender offer.

headline: WBD urges shareholders to reject Paramount bid, Medline IPO
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) urging shareholders to reject Paramount Skydance's (PSKY) bid for the media giant, Tesla (TSLA) could see sales in California halted over its marketing practices, and Medline (MDLN) prepares to begin trading today in what is seen as the year's biggest IPO. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

summary: Confirming reports, the Warner Bros. Discovery board urged shareholders to stick with the Netflix deal.

content.summary: Confirming reports, the Warner Bros. Discovery board urged shareholders to stick with the Netflix deal.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Board of Directors Unanimously Recommends Shareholders Reject Paramount Tender Offer
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. ("Warner Bros. Discovery" or "WBD") (NASDAQ: WBD) today announced that its Board of Directors (the "Board") has unanimously determined that the tender offer launched by Paramount Skydance ("PSKY") (NASDAQ: PSKY) on December 8, 2025 is not in the best interests of WBD and its shareholders and does not meet the criteria of a "Superior Proposal" under the terms of WBD's merger agreement with Netflix announced on December 5, 2025.

content.title: Warner Bros. Discovery Board of Directors Unanimously Recommends Shareholders Reject Paramount Tender Offer
content.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. ("Warner Bros. Discovery" or "WBD") (NASDAQ: WBD) today announced that its Board of Directors (the "Board") has unanimously determined that the tender offer launched by Paramount Skydance ("PSKY") (NASDAQ: PSKY) on December 8, 2025 is not in the best interests of WBD and its shareholders and does not meet the criteria of a "Superior Proposal" under the terms of WBD's merger agreement with Netflix announced on December 5, 2025.
